intro: Spermacoce caudata, commonly known as the whip穗 or beakweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce caudata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
